news.title: I reported my offensive colleague to the Met - why did he get his job back?
news.summary: Izzy Vine reported a colleague who made discriminatory remarks but resigned after he was reinstated.

news.title: Anti-crime pledges will not be met without extra money, warns Met chief
news.summary: In what amounts to a direct plea to the chancellor, Sir Mark Rowley says the police are "overstretched".

news.title: Moment SpaceX Starship spins out of control in test flight
news.summary: Fuel leaks on the rocket caused it to begin spinning, leading to an uncontrolled re-entry through Earth's atmosphere.

news.title: US halts student visa appointments and plans expanded social media vetting
news.summary: The state department says the policy will have "significant implications" for embassies and consulates.

news.title: Crowds overrun US-backed group's new aid distribution site in Gaza
news.summary: Videos show people walking over torn-down fences at the Gaza Humanitarian Foundation's site in Rafah.

news.title: How 'laughing gas' became a deadly - but legal - American addiction
news.summary: Nitrous oxide overdoses have increased in the US, but the substance is still legal as a "culinary product".

news.title: The Papers: 'Drug drive arrest' and 'Worried about Trump?'
news.summary: The driver in the Liverpool incident is suspected of acting while using drugs and the King visits Canada.

news.title: 'Our homes were taken for a road that was never built'
news.summary: Three families speak of the "utter hell" of losing their homes to a road scheme that was cancelled.

news.title: A soft knock - how police arrest a suspected paedophile
news.summary: Police say there has been a marked change in child abuse since the pandemic - with offenders able to contact children online in 30 seconds.

news.title: The tiny island where puffins are thriving despite global decline
news.summary: A record number of puffins have been recorded on Skomer Island despite the birds  being at risk of extinction.
